answers.answer: This is serious stuff and you need a professional explanation. Call her Dr.It is easier (and smarter) to buy a wig, than lose your life. She is probably afraid, and needs a lot of support. You can be a real help and encouragement  to her, but you first need to understand her condition. Then you need to go with her to her appointments, and write down everything the Dr says. There is a lot of information to process, and a written record will be invaluable downt the road.

As the previous poster said, this is serious stuff. It sounds like there is a high possibility of metastises to several areas. You should have a serious discussion with your Grandmother's Oncologist and then one with your Grandmother. To be blunt it seems that it's your hair or your life ... I'm sorry to put it this way but your hair grows back you know. Please encourage her to have the treatment that is recommended. If bones are involved Radiation also comes into play in the treatment program.
Please comment on my above questionThank You

question: Hello,I am very thankful for this site and have learned alot.  My grandmother was diagnosed with Invasive Ductal Carcinoma in Nov 07.  They removed the lump and it had clear margins, but was Grade 3 Nuclear grade 8.  They said at that time it was Stage 1, no lymph node involvement and no Metastatic.well she decided not to do any further treatments after having the lump removed. She was afraid to lose her hair with any treatment.In April of 08 she discovered a lump under her arm, and last week had it removed, and the week before that a PET was done.the lump came back as being Metastatic Carcinoma, the PET scan showed the following results...2.4 x 1.2 cm soft tissue mass in left axilla/left chest wall with mean and maximum metabolic activities.this most likely represents metastatic malignancy.Increased glucose metabolism within bilateral humeral heads as well as in the cervical, thoracic, lumbar, and sacral spine and in the sternum.  Bony metastases can present within this appearance.Small focus of increased glucose metabolism along the inferomedial margin of the left kidney most likely in the left adrenal gland.. This focus represents mean and maximal metabolic activities of approximately 2.5 and 11.5 SUV, respectively.  Metastatic malignancy in this location could present with this appearance.What exactly does this all mean? And they are wanting to treat her (if she will) with Tykerb and or Xeloda.I have read about Xeloda and am really nervous as she has a heart condition, diabetes, she is on blood thinner warafin, and she is Polythycemia Vera. (Not sure of the spelling).What stage would she be in? And if she chooses not to have treatments can she live years and years without it? Or do you think as I do she will not survive till the end of the year?Thank You for your responses.
title: Grandmas Diagnosis
